description: Multiple choice and short answer questions testing understanding of functional anatomy and application to clinical scenarios. Conducted during exam period.
Two tests (mid-term and end-term) identifying anatomical structures on cadaveric specimens, models, medical images, and answering short theory questions. Covers weeks 1-4 and 1-9 content.
Weekly group assignments in tutorials involving research on allocated topics, problem-solving, and critical analysis of scientific literature. Assessed by instructors and peers.
Weekly quizzes testing understanding of weekly concepts and structure/function relationships in clinical contexts. Conducted in tutorials.
